attributes.comment:
As you know the cost of naturalization is an expense that is usually paid for by
the immigrant. It is unfair to raise the application fees by 80 per cent at one
time. If USCIS wants to raise the application fees then they should be raised in
phases at say 10 per cent per year for the next eight years.

The increase in fees will put many individual and families in financial
hardship. I have a family and will end up paying thousands in applications and
lawyer fees. This is a big investment on the part of the potential immigrant. I
have been waiting for over five years and have still not received by green
card. Hence, I think it is unjustified that USCIS increase their fees without
improving their services to the public.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Mehmood Zafar
